cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSW of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeastern Bahamas today, forecast to skirt the north coast of Cuba, pass near the Florida Keys Saturday, then turn northwest toward the eastern Gulf of Mexico with a probable landfall along the Florida Panhandle late Sunday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for northern Haiti coast, southeastern Bahamas, and several eastern/central Cuban provinces
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas, north coast of Cuba, Florida Keys and Peninsula, eastern Gulf Coast from southwest Florida to the Florida Panhandle, then inland across Alabama/Georgia
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (most guidance shows <4 inches for SE Georgia)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (primary surge threat confined to Gulf Coast landfall area)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible early next week with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts unlikely but cannot be ruled out (peak chance 9%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Georgia Atlantic coast from Fred’s current forecast track
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy showers Monday–Tuesday could produce 1–3 inches, locally up to 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out in rain bands if the center tracks farther east, but current risk is low
